name: sturdiness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being physically strong and solid or thick, and therefore unlikely to break or be hurt: Their canoes were noted for their sturdiness. the soft sturdiness of a growing child's limbs
literary the quality of being strong and determined: Collingwood played with typical sturdiness. She is the very image of mental sturdiness.
More examplesFewer examplesWe will spend whatever it takes to ensure the sturdiness of the state's bridges.She relies on her physical sturdiness to stay healthy.There's a quiet sturdiness about his actions.It is a testimony to the sturdiness of their respective characters that the relationship works so well.
